pull_request.title: fix: Removed the parent padding and instead applied padding individually.
pull_request.body: Fixes #3389 The divider is now starting from the window and stretching to the edge of the Sidebar without hindering with rest of the Sidebar UI. --- #### PR Checklist - [x] My code adheres to [AppFlowy's Conventions](https://docs.appflowy.io/docs/documentation/software-contributions/conventions) - [x] I've listed at least one issue that this PR fixes in the description above. - [ ] I've added a test(s) to validate changes in this PR, or this PR only contains semantic changes. - [x ] All existing tests are passing.

issue.title: [Bug] divider between new page and trash does not stretch to edge of sidebar

labels.name: good first issue for devs
labels.description: for the community members to claim

issue.body:
### Bug Description

Title says all.

Please make sure that while fixing this, the rest of the sidebar UI doesn't change

### How to Reproduce

1. Open AppFlowy.

### Expected Behavior

The divider should start from the edge of the window and extend to the edge of the sidebar

### Operating System

macOS

### AppFlowy Version(s)

0.3.1

### Screenshots


![Screenshot 2023-09-12 at 9 29 24 PM](https://github.com/AppFlowy-IO/AppFlowy/assets/71320345/6dfe6c00-5956-488d-9d01-d838e680ddb3)

### Additional Context

_No response_

comment.body: Hi Team. I have worked on a fix for this. Please assign this to me.

issue.title: [Bug] '+' to add an option to a select column
issue.body:
### Bug Description

I use W11-Home (22H2, Build 22621.2428) and AppFlowy-portable (V0.3.6). Here's what I just noticed: 1) Kanban: When I add a new property with "multi-select" and then want to add new options, then for language "English" nothing happens when I click on the plus symbol and for language "German" the card is too narrow so that the plus symbol is outside the card and cannot be selected (see screenshots). Is the plus symbol necessary at all, since a new option is automatically created when text is entered?
![image](https://github.com/AppFlowy-IO/AppFlowy/assets/12026239/80811825-42aa-4dcd-99a8-b679ca1f7279)
![image](https://github.com/AppFlowy-IO/AppFlowy/assets/12026239/0c180fd1-f33b-4f62-a673-d9d5a8bde60d)


### How to Reproduce

Try to click '+' to add an option to a select column

### Expected Behavior

I can click '+' to add a new option

### Operating System

Windows 11

### AppFlowy Version(s)

v0.3.7

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

comment.body: @annieappflowy Please assign this issue to me. I would like to work on this

issue.title: feat:add toast in trash and confirm dialog
issue.body:
<!---
Thank you for submitting a pull request to AppFlowy. The team will dedicate their best efforts to reviewing and approving your pull request. If you have any questions about the project or feedback for us, please join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/wdjWUXXhtw).
-->

<!---
If your pull request adds a new feature, please drag and drop a video into this section to showcase what you've done! If not, you may delete this section.
-->

### Feature Preview
- Show toast when delete/restore a single one file in the trash

- Pop up a confirm dialog when delete/restore all files in the trash



https://github.com/AppFlowy-IO/AppFlowy/assets/14248245/5b1f2c3a-921f-42d3-aca9-4fb30d7e0c5c



<!---
List at least one issue here that this PR addresses. If it fixes the issue, please use the [fixes](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/working-with-advanced-formatting/using-keywords-in-issues-and-pull-requests) keyword to close the issue. For example:
fixes https://github.com/AppFlowy-IO/AppFlowy/pull/2106
-->

---

<!---
Before you mark this PR ready for review, run through this checklist!
-->

#### PR Checklist

- [ ] My code adheres to [AppFlowy's Conventions](https://docs.appflowy.io/docs/documentation/software-contributions/conventions)
- [ ] I've listed at least one issue that this PR fixes in the description above.
- [ ] I've added a test(s) to validate changes in this PR, or this PR only contains semantic changes.
- [ ] All existing tests are passing.

comment.body: In the preview I didn't see the snackbar when deleting a view. If you do have one there, what do you think about adding an action to the snackbar to undo?
Instead of a fixed index, I feel it more appropriate to take the group which `isDefault`, since that will work no matter if you change the ordering. What do you think?

issue.body:

List at least one issue here that this PR addresses. If it fixes the issue, please use the [fixes](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/working-with-advanced-formatting/using-keywords-in-issues-and-pull-requests) keyword to close the issue. For example:

Thank you for submitting a pull request to AppFlowy. The team will dedicate their best efforts to reviewing and approving your pull request. If you have any questions about the project or feedback for us, please join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/wdjWUXXhtw).
-->

<!---
If your pull request adds a new feature, please drag and drop a video into this section to showcase what you've done! If not, you may delete this section.
-->

List at least one issue here that this PR addresses. If it fixes the issue, please use the [fixes](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/working-with-advanced-formatting/using-keywords-in-issues-and-pull-requests) keyword to close the issue. For example:

pull_request.title: feat: support copy handler
pull_request.body:
<!---
Thank you for submitting a pull request to AppFlowy. The team will dedicate their best efforts to reviewing and approving your pull request. If you have any questions about the project or feedback for us, please join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/wdjWUXXhtw).
-->

<!---
If your pull request adds a new feature, please drag and drop a video into this section to showcase what you've done! If not, you may delete this section.
-->

### Feature Preview

- [x] Supports a copy interface, with  selection parameters for outputting JSON/HTML/TEXT within the selection

<!---
List at least one issue here that this PR addresses. If it fixes the issue, please use the [fixes](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/working-with-advanced-formatting/using-keywords-in-issues-and-pull-requests) keyword to close the issue. For example:
fixes https://github.com/AppFlowy-IO/AppFlowy/pull/2106
-->

---

<!---
Before you mark this PR ready for review, run through this checklist!
-->

#### PR Checklist

- [ ] My code adheres to [AppFlowy's Conventions](https://docs.appflowy.io/docs/documentation/software-contributions/conventions)
- [ ] I've listed at least one issue that this PR fixes in the description above.
- [ ] I've added a test(s) to validate changes in this PR, or this PR only contains semantic changes.
- [ ] All existing tests are passing.
